availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: George Chilton Riffe (Lincoln County, KY, farmer and KY senator)

body.p: Lincoln County, Kentucky, farmer and politician. Kentucky native. Married to Elizabeth Anderson Riffe. Father of Mary Frances Riffe, James C. Riffe, Emily Riffe, Jesse P. Riffe, Susan H. Riffe, Martha A. Riffe, and Henry Clay Riffe. Married to Elizabeth Weatherford Riffe in Lincoln County, Kentucky, on June 14, 1859. Farmer in Casey County, Kentucky, in 1850. Owned twenty enslaved persons in Casey County in 1850. Farmer in Lincoln County in 1860. Owned fourteen enslaved persons in Casey County in 1860. Senator for the Commonwealth of Kentucky from 1863 to 1867.

Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records – Microfilm (1852-1914), KDLA, Rolls #994045, Lincoln County Marriages, 1859, p. 12 of microfilm.
Vital Statistics Original Death Certificates – Microfilm (1911-1965), KDLA, Film #7016133: All Counties, 1911, File #11547, p. 1553 of 3257 of microfilm.
